properties.areaDesc: Galveston Island and Bolivar Peninsula; Matagorda Islands; Brazoria Islands
properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 21 at 3:44PM CST until January 23 at 1:00AM CST by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
properties.description:
* WHAT...Along Gulf facing beaches...minor coastal flooding with
wave run up during high tides on Wednesday afternoon. Tide
levels could reach around 3.5ft MLLW at high tide. Strong
southeast winds will also cause rip currents.

* WHERE...Matagorda Islands, Brazoria Islands and Galveston
Island and Bolivar Peninsula Counties.

* WHEN...From Wednesday morning through late Wednesday night.

* IMPACTS...Rip currents will make swimming hazardous if you brave
swimming in 60 degree water temperatures. Minor coastal flooding
to Highway 87 on Bolivar Peninsula and other Gulf facing
beaches.
properties.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT
